articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Slams Anti-DPRK Campaign over Its Projected Satellite Launch
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Slams Anti-DPRK Campaign over Its Projected Satellite Launch
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry issued a statement on Tuesday slamming the campaign of the U.S. and some of its allied forces to hold in check the DPRK's projected launch of experimental communications satellite "Kwangmyongsong 2" for peaceful purposes. 
					 It said: 
					
					 It is a legitimate right equally enjoyed by all countries of the earth to explore outer space and use it for peaceful purposes. 
					
					 However, they claim that it is necessary for the UN Security Council to take issue with the above-said matter, asserting that the DPRK's satellite launch poses a threat to them because the technology used for the rocket for carrying the satellite is not distinguishable from that involved in a long-range missile.
					
					 Japan which has committed the biggest crimes against the DPRK is taking the lead in this anti-DPRK racket.
					
					 This cannot be interpreted otherwise than the height of the behaviors of those bereft of elementary reason and discreet as it reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The countries which find fault with the DPRK's satellite launch including the U.S. and Japan launched satellites before it.
					
					 The claim of these countries that the technology involved in the satellite launch is just the same as that used for a long-range missile bespeaks that they developed missile technology before any others and stockpiled more missiles than any others. 
					
					 The brigandish logic that they may launch as many satellites as they please but the DPRK should not be allowed to do so is a revelation of hostility towards it. 
					
					 Their assertion is that those countries hostile to them should not have access to even means for self-defence nor develop anything for peaceful purposes.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they think these brazen-faced high-handed and arbitrary practices will work on the DPRK. 
					
					 There are not a few countries in the world that launched satellites but the UNSC has never dealt with nor taken issue with the satellite launch by other individual countries. Because it has no mandate to interfere in the independent rights of the sovereign states to the development and use of outer space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 The above-said assertion made by those countries is just the same far-fetched assertion that both kitchen knives and bayonets should be targets of disarmament as both are similar to each other. 
					
					 The attempts of Japan and the U.S., the parties to the six-party talks, to deny the DPRK's right to use space for peaceful purposes and infringe upon its sovereignty as a discriminatory measure diametrically run counter to the "spirit of mutual respect and equality" enshrined in the September 19 joint statement on the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 If such hostile act is perpetrated in the name of the UNSC, this will precisely mean its denial of the said statement.
					
					 The abrogation of the said statement would deprive the six-party talks of any ground to exist or their meaning.
					
					 The six-party talks are now on the verge of collapse due to Japan's non-fulfillment of its commitment, an intention to delay the denuclearization of the peninsula in a bid to find a pretext for going nuclear.
					
					 The reality today when the said talks are in the danger of collapse due to the hostile acts of some participating countries once again testifies to the truth of the DPRK's stand that it cannot abandon its nuclear weapons even in 100 years unless the hostile relations are terminated.
					
					 The responsibility for the deadlocked talks will rest entirely with Japan, to begin with, and other countries which rejected the "spirit of mutual respect and equality" enshrined in the Sep. 19 joint statement. 
					
					 If it is impossible to put an end to the hostile relations through dialogue, then there is no other option but to bolster up the muscle to deter the hostile acts.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Greece
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Greece
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Mar. 16 sent a message of greeting to Carlos Papoulias, President of Greece, on the occasion of its national day.
					Kim in the message sincerely wished the President good health and success in the work for the wellbeing of the friendly Greek people.

articles.title: Reception Given by Pakistani Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Pakistani Ambassador
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Noorullah Khan, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Monday to mark the Day of Pakistan.
					 Present there on invitation were Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Myong San, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and officials concerned, and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the Pakistani embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Day of Pakistan Observed
articles.content:
Day of Pakistan Observed
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Pakistani embassy here took place at the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Pyongyang Daily Necessities Factory on Tuesday on the occasion of the Day of Pakistan. 
					 Present there on invitation were Noorullah Khan, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK, and a staff member of his embassy.
					
					 Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, members of the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Association and officials of the factory were on hand. 
					
					 After being briefed on the history of the factory, the participants looked round various production processes. 
					
					 Then, they listened to the economic agitation conducted by the art group of the factory and talked to one another about the need to boost the bilateral relations, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: Cuban Film Week Opens
articles.content:
Cuban Film Week Opens
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A Cuban film week was opened with due ceremony at the Taedongmun Cinema Tuesday on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban revolution and the 50th anniversary of the foundation of the Cuban Institute of Art and Movie Industry.
					 Present there were Paek Han Su, vice-chairman of the State Film Commission, Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is vice-chairman of the Korean-Cuban Solidarity Committee, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of movie industry and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Jose Manuel Galego Montano and staff members of his embassy and diplomatic envoys of different countries and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 Participants watched Cuban feature film "Scent of Oak".

articles.title: Varied Anti-Tuberculosis Activities
articles.content:
Varied Anti-Tuberculosis Activities
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Varied anti-tuberculosis activities are being conducted in the DPRK in step with the strategy for eradicating tuberculosis in the world.
					 The DPRK government has directed deep attention to the work for preventing and uprooting the infectious diseases as an important part of its health policy from long ago.
					
					 First of all, efforts are being concentrated on the hygienic propaganda against tuberculosis, while raising the social interest in the importance of the anti-tuberculosis activities and strengthening support to them.
					
					 The doctors in charge of households and prophylactic treatment organs are enlisted in the work in a positive way.
					
					 Meanwhile, the hygienic propaganda is being conducted through mass media and a new scientific film "Tuberculosis and Health" was released.
					
					 Colorful activities are also held in the country every year on the occasion of the "World TB's Day" (March 24).
					
					 The government has taken positive measures to prevent tuberculosis.
					
					 As part of the measures, all the newborn babies are vaccinated with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) within seven days from 18 hours after birth and a step is being taken to supply preventive medicine to them without interruption.
					
					 Efforts are being exerted not only to regularly conduct medical check-up through medical consultation and medical examination car but also to block all the channels to the outbreak of TB cases.
					
					 The DPRK is further deepening contacts with the World Health Organization and other international organizations in the anti-tuberculosis activities.

articles.title: Taeryonggang Sports Team's Successes in Acrobatic Gymnastics
articles.content:
Taeryonggang Sports Team's Successes in Acrobatic Gymnastics
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The Taeryonggang Sports Team in Sinuiju City of the DPRK is channeling much effort into developing acrobatic gymnastics.
					 The coaches are raising the level of the gymnasts on the basis of creation and completion of diverse and unique technical movements.
					
					 The sports team which has directed much effort to acrobatic gymnastics from Juche 82 (1993) has proved successful in national and international games over last 16 years.
					
					 During the years its acrobatic gymnasts have won one trophy-cup, over 170 gold, over 300 silver and over 160 copper medals in the DPRK championships, the Mangyongdae Cup Sports Contest and other national contests.
					
					 They also brought home two gold medals and four silver medals in the Asian Acrobatic Gymnastics Championships and other international contests.
					
					 They were honored with three gold medals, four silver medals and five copper medals in the acrobatic gymnastic event of the 11th People's Sports Contest held in 2008.
					
					 Its gymnasts are intensifying training with a will to add luster to the prestige of the country in all contests.

articles.title: KCNA Demands Closure of U.S. Secret Prisons
articles.content:
KCNA Demands Closure of U.S. Secret Prisons
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The special rapporteur for torture issue of the UN Human Rights Council and the UN special envoy for human rights and anti-terrorism, addressing the recent 10th meeting of the council, declared that an international investigation would be conducted into the secret prisons operated by the United States.
					 They denounced the atrocities committed by the U.S. as the "most horrible acts," asserting that they would not allow the U.S. to evade its responsibility for them with ease on account of the replacement of the U.S. administration and that the investigation should be continued till everything has been clarified.
					
					 This is a proper step taken by the international community against the U.S. which has committed ceaseless human rights abuses in different parts of the world under the signboard of "war on terrorism."
					
					 The U.S. set up a secret prison in Guantanamo of Cuba in the wake of the "September 11 incident" and established such prisons in different countries of the world and even on warships.
					
					 It arrested many people and has kept them in custody for a long period, ruthlessly violating their freedom and human rights.
					
					26,000 people are now detained, without having even a chance to stand a fair trial, the most elementary human rights.
					
					 They are put to beating, sleep depravation, water boarding, sexual torture and other forms of mediaeval torture. Guiltless people are disappearing without being known to the outside, while undergoing unbearable pain.
					
					 These are the hideous human rights abuses quite contrary to the humanitarian principles of modern international law including the "Geneva Convention" and international law on human rights.
					
					 Precisely for this reason the International Committee of the Red Cross in a report in 2007 defined the U.S. atrocities as "cruel and inhuman contempt of personality" and "torture."
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the U.S. is trying to keep the secret prisons censured by the world.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the U.S. attorney general, while announcing the "new standard for the operation of the facilities for 'suspected terrorists'" in Guantanamo on March 13, blustered that it is inevitable to operate these facilities in a way to tighten national security.
					
					 These outbursts cannot but sound very surprising as they are let loose without let-up under the pretext of "examining" the closure of the secret prison in Guantanamo.
					
					 During the office of the Bush administration the U.S. left no means untried to cover up the operation of secret prisons with such crafty words as "national security".
					
					 The new U.S. administration is echoing such words only to reveal its intention not to close them.
					
					 The U.S. had better close as early as possible the secret prisons ill-famed for lots of human rights abuses.

articles.title: Aim Sought by U.S. in Relocating Its Forces Overseas Disclosed
articles.content:
Aim Sought by U.S. in Relocating Its Forces Overseas Disclosed
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. recently decided to transfer some of its Marines based in Okinawa to Guam. It was prompted by the intention to boost the capability to cope with the contingency in the region including the Korean Peninsula and Taiwan Strait and use Guam as a base to contain its strategic rivals and potential enemies in the Western Pacific. Minju Joson Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary. 
					 It continues:
					
					 In case that the relocation of the U.S. forces is completed in the Asia-Pacific region, the U.S. will acquire military capability to militarily contain China and Russia and rapidly react to the "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula and the Taiwan Strait.
					
					 This indicates that the U.S. is keen to hold military supremacy in the Asia-Pacific region in a desperate bid to bind big powers and military giants in the region hand and foot and realize its wild ambition for world domination come what may. 
					
					 Now that the U.S. is seeking military supremacy in the region, the countries concerned are unlikely to remain a passive onlooker to the development. Accordingly, this will lead to the escalation of the military confrontation and contradictions among the big powers in the region and adversely affect the peace and stability and the developments in the region.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the U.S. is the arch criminal wrecking the peace and stability in the world.
					
					 The U.S. strategy for relocating its forces in the region is directly affecting the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The grave military tension escalated by the U.S. on the peninsula compels the DPRK to bolster its war deterrent.
					
					 The DPRK will increase its capability for self-defence in every way in order to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and its right to existence.

articles.title: U.S. Unabashed Design for Aggression under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Unabashed Design for Aggression under Fire
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- Joint military exercises staged by the U.S. bellicose forces are aimed at mounting a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK any moment, and they are a revelation of the U.S. unchanged hostile policy towards the DPRK and its aggression design, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a signed commentary.
					 This has been proved by the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises recently staged by the U.S., the commentary notes, adding that the exercises were an extremely adventurous rehearsal of operation for attack on the DPRK, a nuclear test war, unprecedented in history in view of the scale of aggression armed forces involved in the exercises and their period.
					
					 Through the recent rehearsal the U.S. imperialists further rounded off the preparations for igniting another Korean war and seriously threatened and blackmailed the DPRK, it says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is going to continue the anti-DPRK war exercises with the mobilization of latest arms equipment in the future, too.
					
					 The DPRK and the U.S. are technically at war. It will be the height of folly for one side to sit back with folded arms when the other side is sharpening the sword to kill it.
					
					 The tense situation in which a war may break out any moment is prevailing on the Korean Peninsula due to the anti-DPRK military racket of the U.S. bellicose forces. The present reality compels the army and people of the DPRK to harden their will to further increase the self-reliant military capability for self-defence with the heightened vigilance.
					
					 It is a very legitimate exercise of sovereignty for the DPRK to build up its self-reliant military capability in order to defend the supreme interests and security of the country from the U.S. imperialists' reckless moves for provoking a new war.
					
					 The self-reliant defence capability of the DPRK serves as the reliable shield for preventing a war and the strong military guarantee for defending its sovereignty and peace.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will as ever direct big efforts to bolstering the war deterrent to cope with the U.S. imperialists' moves for aggression on the DPRK being intensified with each passing day.

articles.title: Actions Called for Putting End to Lee Myung Bak Group's Treachery
articles.content:
Actions Called for Putting End to Lee Myung Bak Group's Treachery
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors will certainly be forced to pay for such hideous acts of treachery as escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen and running wild to start a war of aggression against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces, swimming against the trend of the times towards national reconciliation and unity.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday warns this in a signed article.
					
					 Accusing the group of traitors of staging the provocative Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises in collusion with foreign forces despite the repeated warnings of the DPRK and all Koreans' strong protest and denunciation, the article stresses it is impossible to improve the relations between the north and the south nor is it possible to achieve lasting peace on the Korean Peninsula and national independence and reunification as long as the group is allowed to stay in power.
					
					 Citing facts that the Lee group has blocked reconciliation and cooperation between the compatriots and brought the inter-Korean relations to stalemate quite contrary to the nation's desire for reunification, the article terms the Lee group ferocious warmongers keen to realize the wild ambition for achieving "unification by invading the north," backed by foreign aggressors. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is due to the adventurous rackets kicked up by the bellicose Lee regime to provoke a war of aggression against the DPRK in collusion with foreign forces that the June 15 era of reunification is facing a blatant challenge and the situation on the Korean Peninsula remains so tense that a war may break out any moment.
					
					 It is as clear as a pikestaff that the longer the Lee group stays in power, the further the inter-Korean relations will be strained and the Koreans will suffer a nuclear war disaster in the end.
					
					 The Korean nation desirous of national reconciliation and unity and peace and reunification should not tolerate the acts of treachery of the Lee regime going against the times and the desire of the nation.

articles.title: Suppression of Progressive Forces Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Progressive Forces Flailed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on March 19 denouncing the puppet Lee Myung Bak group of traitors for its suppression of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy (Mingahyop).
					 In a press release the organization recalled that on March 18 the judicial authorities arrested Jo Sun Dok, former permanent chairperson of Mingahyop, on the charge of the violation of the "law on punishment of violence and other actions."
					
					 The authorities claimed that Jo Sun Dok "committed violence against an assemblyman" and "had harbored discontent with normal legislative activities" though Jo protested against the "Grand National Party" trying to railroad the "evil bills", the organization charged.
					
					 It branded such violence by the authorities as a politically-motivated suppression of Mingahyop, a human rights organization, and, moreover, crackdown on the organizations for democratic and progressive movement.
					
					 The authorities have called the said case into question though they did not punish policemen when they committed group violence against an "assemblyman" from an opposition party on the spot of candlelight struggle, the organization pointed out, adding that it was motivated by a political aim.
					
					 It declared that the progressive forces would form a body for taking a joint counteraction and wage the struggle urging the release of Jo.

articles.title: Annual Meeting of Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held
articles.content:
Annual Meeting of Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification was held in Havana on Mar. 17.
					 Attending it were the Cuban minister of Higher Education who is chairman of the committee, the first vice-chairman and members of the committee and the vice-president of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and other officials concerned.
					
					 The ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Havana were present on invitation.
					
					 The meeting reviewed last year's work of the committee and discussed its action program for this year.

articles.title: Important Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Important Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Different Countries
Pyongyang, March 24 (KCNA) -- A lecture was held in Democratic Congo and a photo and book exhibition and a friendly gathering at the Laos-Korea Youth Friendship Centre on Mar. 11 and 16 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					Displayed at the photo and book exhibition hall were photos and books showing the Songun revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Jean Baptiste Nkoy, general secretary of the People's Rally for Socialism of Democratic Congo, in the lecture said that thanks to the indefatigable Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean People's Army has further strengthened into a matchlessly invincible army fully prepared politico-ideologically and in military technique and acquired the reliable war deterrent able to frustrate the enemies' any aggression.
					
					A member of the Vientiane City Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Youth Union and other participants in the friendly gathering said that the KPA founded by Kim Il Sung and led by
						 Kim Jong Il is invincible and that it will always emerge ever-victorious under the great Songun leadership.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Mina de Jaeryong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Mina de Jaeryong
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Mina de Jaeryong.
					  Tras escuchar la explicacion ante el mapa de panorama del area minera Sungri, el Dirigente recorrio el campo de extraccion para analizar detalladamente el estado de promocion de la labor preparativa para activar la produccion y el de la produccion de minerales.
					
					  El Dirigente vio el aspecto de trabajo de los mineros en el campo de extraccion y les dio estimulo a estos que crean el milagro y renovacion en la lucha audaz por producir el nuevo y gran auge revolucionario.
					
					  El dijo que durante el largo tiempo desde el periodo de la construccion de nueva patria de posliberacion hasta la fecha, los obreros de la mina con ardiente patriotismo enviaron a tiempo los minerales de hierro de buena calidad a las fundiciones de hierro y contribuyeron asi grandemente al desarrollo de la economia del pais.
					
					  Destaco que con el mismo espiritu y  el mismo vigor de aquel entonces deben manifestar mas plenamente el impetu heroico de la clase obrera coreana tambien en la labor final para abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  Indico que la Mina de Jaeryong es la importante empresa que esta directamente relacionada con la produccion de hierro de varias  fundiciones de hierro como el Complejo Siderurgico Hwanghae y presento las tareas programaticas que sirven de guia para desarrollar la mina con la vista al futuro.
					
					   Es la vasta y dificil tarea terminar en el corto plazo los preparativos para aumento vertiginoso de la produccion de minerales de hierro, pero, sera posible cumplirla con anticipacion a la vista del extraordinario entusiasmo de lucha de los mineros quienes avanzan como rafaga de viento acortando el siglo en respuesta al llamamiento del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, dijo.
					
					  Para normalizar en alto nivel la produccion de minerales de hierro deben llevar a cabo la politica del partido de desprender y  tratar la gran cantidad de minerales, indico y prosiguio que para esto es preciso anteponer activamente el arranque del esteril, y realizar el engrandecimiento de todos los equipos de extraccion, trasporte y cribado y, al mismo tiempo, elevar la tasa de funcionamiento de estos equipos al hacer bien su mantenimiento y reparacion.
					
					  Puesto que los minerales de hierro son el preciso recurso imperiosamente necesario al desarrollo del pais, es preciso utilizar todos los minerales sin despreciar ni un trazo, enseno. 
					
					   Para eso debe anteponer la prospeccion, preparar suficientemente la cantidad de minerales de reserva y, a la vez, tomar estrictamente las medidas de extraccion en la capa profunda basada en los avanzados de la ciencia y tecnica.
					
					  Recorriendo la zona de la mina subrayo que al tomar en consideracion el caracter de la mina a cielo abierto, hay que hacer bien el arreglo zonal y acondicionar en lo higienico y en lo cultural el recinto de la mina y la aldea para hacer florecer plenamente .la cultura avanzada de la clase obrera. 
					
					    Apunto que deben prestar la gran atencion al trabajo y la vida de los obreros de esta mina porque estos dedican al trabajo al aire libre durante todas las estaciones a riesgo de las lluvias y nieves.
					
					Dijo que aunque son menos de tres meses desde cuando se encendio en Kangson la antorcha del nuevo y gran auge revolucionario, se registro un gran salto, una gran innovacion sin precedente en todos los dominios incluidas la industria metalurgica  y la de maquinaria, gracias a lo cual el poderio de nuestra industria autoctona se aumento cada dia mas considerablemente y anadio que este milagro vertiginoso anuncia de antemano la cierta victoria de la construccion de la gran potencia prospera.
					
					  Por la lucha dinamica de nuestro pueblo por abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera hasta el centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung, todo el pais bulle como la lava de volcan activo, preciso el Dirigente y acentuo que esta epoca emocionante en que comienza el gran cambio secular  es precisamente el tiempo en que todos los militantes del partido y otros trabajadores que son los soldados y discipulos del Lider Padre deberan dedicar todo lo suyo a la prosperidad de la patria madre.
					
					  El Dirigente expreso su gran esperanza y conviccion de que los mineros de Jaeryong demostraran el impetu heroico e invencible en la gran lucha por la construccion de la gran potencia prospera al cumplir la mision y el deber honrosos como patrulleros, exploradores de la construccion de la economia socialista.
					
					  Le acompanaron la secretaria responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, Kim Rak Hui, y los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Nam Gi y Jang Song Thaek.

articles.title: RPDC rechaza campana de algunos participantes en cita seis-partita
articles.content:
RPDC rechaza campana de algunos participantes en cita seis-partita
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ATCC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 24 una declaracion condenando a Estados Unidos y sus satelites que libran una intensa campana para impedir el lanzamiento del satelite piloto de comunicaciones "Kwangmyongsong-No.2" para fines pacificos por parte de la RPDC.
					  Todos los paises del globo terraqueo tienen por igual el derecho legitimo de explotar el espacio y usarlo en fines pacificos, senala la nota y continua:
					
					  Pero, EE.UU. y algunas fuerzas seguidoras insisten en cuestionar el lanzamiento de satelite por nuestro pais en el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU difundiendo la teoria de que esto deviene una amenaza a si mismos porque la tecnologia del cohete transportador de satelite no se difiere de la del misil de largo alcance.
					
					  Al frente de esta campana anti-RPDC esta Japon, que cometio crimenes mas grandes contra ella.
					
					Esto deviene el climax de la logica de bandido que perdio la mas elemental razon y juicio.
					
					  EE.UU., Japon y otros paises, que cuestionan ese asunto, son los que han lanzado ya sus satelites antes que la RPDC.
					
					  Si la tecnica de lanzamiento del satelite fuera igual a la del misil de largo alcance, esto quiere decir que esos paises desarrollaron primero la tecnologia de misiles y tienen acumulados mucha cantidad de estos artefactos.
					
					  La logica de bandido, consistente en que la RPDC no debe hacer lo que ellos si pueden hacer, deviene la demostracion de la hostilidad a ella.
					
					  Estarian muy equivocados si piensan que sera aceptado por la RPDC el cinico, despotico y arbitrario criterio de que los paises hostilizados por ellos no deben poseer el medio de autodefensa ni desarrollarse por via pacifica.
					
					Si bien no son pocos en este mundo los paises que lanzan satelites, el Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU nunca habia abordado ni cuestionado este problema de algun otro pais.
					
					Es que ese organismo no tiene ninguna autoridad para intervenir en los derechos independientes de los Estados soberanos a la investigacion, el desarrollo y el uso pacificos del espacio.
					
					La opinion de que el lanzamiento de satelite debe ser tratado en el Consejo de Seguridad porque la tecnologia, que se requiere para este fin, no se difiere de la del misil de largo alcance, es una absurdidad igual a que el cuchillo de cocina debe ser el objeto de desarme porque es parecido a la bayoneta.
					
					Las pretensiones de Japon y EE.UU., participantes en las conversaciones a 6 bandas, de negar discriminatoriamente solo el derecho al uso pacifico del cosmos de la RPDC y de atentar su soberania contravienen totalmente al "espiritu de respeto mutuo e igualdad" estipulado en la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre para la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si las acciones hostiles de este tipo se cometen en nombre del Consejo de Seguridad, esto significaria que este mismo aparato de la ONU esta rehusando la citada declaracion.
					
					Cuando se invalide este documento, la cita a 6 bandas no tendra la base ni el sentido para seguir entablandose.
					
					Estas conversaciones estan ya de por si a punto de ruptura debido al incumplimiento del deber de Japon que trata de procurar el pretexto de su armamentismo nuclear al dilatar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La realidad de hoy, en que este dialogo esta proximo al fracaso debido a las acciones hostiles de algunos participantes, vuelve a comprobar la justeza de nuestra posicion de no renunciar a las armas nucleares, aunque pasen cien anos, antes de que fueran eliminadas las relaciones hostiles.
					
					La responsabilidad por la quiebra de la cita a 6 bandas recaera enteramente sobre los paises, en particular Japon, que rehusaron el "espiritu de respeto mutuo e igualdad".
					
					  Ante la imposibilidad de eliminar las relaciones hostiles mediante el dialogo, no tenemos otro remedio que consolidar las fuerzas disuasorias de las acciones hostiles.

articles.title: ATCC demanda el cierre de las carceles secretas de EE.UU.
articles.content:
ATCC demanda el cierre de las carceles secretas de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ATCC) -- En la reciente X reunion del Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU, el relator especial encargado del problema de la tortura de este organismo y el enviado especial de la ONU encargado de DDHH y antiterrorismo declararon que realizarian la investigacion internacional sobre las carceles secretas operadas por Estados Unidos
					  Tras calificar de "mas terribles" las atrocidades de EE.UU., ellos enfatizaron que no permitirian que este imperio se libere facilmente de la responsabilidad pese al cambio de su administracion" y que "la investigacion debe continuar hasta que todo este claro". 
					
					  Esto deviene una justa medida que tomo la sociedad internacional en cuanto a EE.UU que viola sin interrupcion los DDHH en varios lugares del mundo bajo el vistoso rotulo de la "guerra antiterrorista".
					
					  Despues de los "atentados del 11 de septiembre", EE.UU. instalo una carcel secreta en Guantanamo de Cuba y luego, en varios paises y hasta en los buques de guerra.
					
					  Este imperio encarcela a numerosas personas durante largo tiempo violando flagrantemente sus libertades y derechos humanos.
					
					  Actualmente, 26 mil se encuentran tras las rejas sin haberse sometido nunca al juicio imparcial, que deviene el mas elemental derecho humano.
					
					  Ellos reciben las torturas medievales como el golpe, el no dejar dormir, la tortura con agua y la sexual.
					
					  Muchos inocentes desaparecen en silencio al cabo de sufrir insoportables penalidades.
					
					  Esta infame violacion de DDHH contraviene a los principios humanitarios de la ley internacional contemporanea como la "Convencion de Ginebra" y al derecho internacional de DDHH.
					
					  Por esta razon, en su informe elaborado en 2007, el Comite Internacional de la Cruz Roja califico las atrocidades de EE.UU. de "crueles, inhumanas y ofensivas a la personalidad" y de "tortura".
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que EE.UU. trata de seguir manteniendo las prisiones secretas, repudiadas hoy por todo el mundo.
					
					  En ese sentido, al publicar el dia 13 la "nueva norma de operacion de los reclusorios de los sospechosos 'terroristas'" en la base de Guantanamo, el secretario norteamericano de Justicia dijo que "es inevitable administrarlos en direccion de garantizar la seguridad nacional". 
					
					 Este espantoso disparate fue pronunciado justamente cuando EE.UU. dice "examinar" el cierre de la prision secreta en Guantanamo.
					
					 Durante el periodo de la administracion Bush, EE.UU. encubrio por todos los medios la administracion de las carceles secretas con las taimadas palabras como la "preservacion de seguridad nacional".
					
					  La repeticion de estas palabras por la nueva administracion norteamericana es una muestra de que ella tampoco quiere eliminar las carceles secretas.
					
					  EE.UU. debe cerrar lo mas pronto posible estas instalaciones donde se cometen incontables crimenes contra los DDHH.

articles.title: Asamblea anual del Comite Cubano de Apoyo a Reunificacion de Corea
articles.content:
Asamblea anual del Comite Cubano de Apoyo a Reunificacion de Corea
Pyongyang, 24 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 17 en la Habana la asamblea anual del Comite Cubano de Apoyo a la Reunificacion de Corea.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Educacion Superior y presidente de ese comite, el primer vicepresidente y otros miembros del mismo comite, el vicepresidente del Instituto Cubano de Amistad con los Pueblos y otros funcionarios cubanos.
					
					  Fueron invitados el embajador coreano y otros miembros de la embajada coreana en Cuba.
					
					  La reunion hizo balance del trabajo realizado el ano pasado por esa entidad y discutio el plan de actividades de este ano.
